page.title: 11Recreation in Alford area
page.content: A list of recreational activities people enjoy will answer the question "But what do you do in the country?" Angling, badminton, bee-keeping, bingo, bowling,(indoor and outdoor), bridge, canoeing, country dancing, computer activities, curling, cycling, draughts (outdoor), darts, football, fishing with a bandy net, flower arranging, gardening, golf, hill-walking, Highland dancing, judo, jogging, keep fit, making music, photography, pool, putting, riding, shooting, skating, skiing (downhill, cross-country, dry ski slope), swimming, sledging, table-tennis, tennis, walking, whist and yoga. A dry ski slope is the latest recreational facility to appear in the village. It will come into operation later in the year.
